intro: Calyptracordia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian calyptracordia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 16,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and dense, leathery leaves. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
